item.title: About
item.description: I am a PhD candidate at Freie Universität Berlin in Jens Eisert’s group. Broadly, I work on quantum computation and quantum information. My research centers on quantum learning and optimization, complexity theory, and verifiable quantum advantage schemes on present-day quantum devices. I completed my Master’s in physics at Freie Universität Berlin, co-supervised by Jens Eisert and Alex Bredariol Grilo. Before that, I obtained my undergraduate degree in Computing Mathematics with a double minor in physics and computer science at the City University of Hong Kong, advised by Oscar Dahlsten.
